intro: Centaurium pulchellum subsp. tenuiflorum, commonly known as slenderflower centaury, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has slender, erect stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom from June to August, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
